Article.Abstract: The HLA restriction and epitope specificity of cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTL) involved in recovery from influenza type B infection have not been extensively characterized. Here lymphocytes obtained from a healthy individual contained virus-specific CTL restricted by class I HLA molecules, HLA-A1, A2, B7 and B8, and the class II HLA molecules, HLA-DR1 and DR3. Four conserved viral epitopes were predicted from allele-specific motifs for peptides interacting with HLA-B8 and HLA-DR1. Bulk CTL recognized three 9mer HLA-B8-restricted peptides from nucleoprotein, residues 30-38, 263-271 and 413-421, and a 13mer HLA-DR1-restricted peptide from hemagglutinin, residues 308-320. The epitopes presented by HLA-A1, HLA-B7 and HLA-DR3 remain undefined. Peptide-specific CTL lines recognized influenza type B virus-infected cells indicating the peptides are representative of naturally processed epitopes. A hemagglutinin peptide-specific CD4 CTL clone expressed approximately 200 molecules of perforin mRNA/cell, suggestive of a functional perforin pathway for target cell lysis. The results indicate a broad CTL response composed of both CD8 CTL and CD4 CTL recognizing viral epitopes presented by multiple HLA molecules.
Article.ArticleTitle: A broad cytotoxic T lymphocyte response to influenza type B virus presented by multiple HLA molecules.
Article.Affiliations: Center for Biologics Evaluation and Research, National Institutes of Health, Bethesda, MD 20892, USA.

Article.Comments: Data originally imported from the Database of Functional Molecular Immunology, FIMM (http://sdmc.lit.org.sg:8080/fimm/) and from the HLA Ligand Database (http://hlaligand.ouhsc.edu/)

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Peptide epitopes were predicted by known allel-specific motifs for peptides interacting with HLA-B8 and HLA-DR1.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Blood was collected from a healthy volunteer with a prior history of influenza infection. Strain was not specified. CTL lines were generated from polyclonal CTL by repeated exposure to peptide-pulsed irradiated autologous B.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A peptide-specific CTL line was able to recognize cells infected with heterologous influenza B B/HK/73 virus.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Blood was collected from a healthy volunteer with a prior history of influenza infection. Strain not specified. CTL lines were generated from polyclonal CTL by repeated exposure to peptide-pulsed irradiated autologous B lymphoblasts.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A peptide-specific CTL line was able to recognize NP30-38 pulsed target cells.

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Blood was collected from healthy volunteer with a prior history of influenza infection. Strain was not specified.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Polyclonal CTL were able to lyse targets presenting NP30-38 in the context of HLA-B8.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A peptide-specific CTL line was able to recognize NP30-38 pulsed targets as well as those pulsed with heterologous NP30-38(K34) from influenza B B/Lee/40 virus. NP30-38(K34) has Lys for Arg at position 34.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Blood was collected from a healthy volunteer with a prior history of influenza infection. Strain was not specified. CTL lines were generated from polyclonal CTL by repeated exposure to peptide-pulsed irradated autologous B lymphoblasts.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A peptide-specific CTL line grown from polyclonals was able to recognize and lyse peptide HA308-320 pulsed targets presenting in the context of class II (HLA-DR1 and -DQ5). FACS analysis indicted that this cell line was 85% CD4+ (data not shown).

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Blood was collected from a healthy volunteer with a prior history of Influenza infection. Strain not specified. CTL lines were generated from polyclonal CTL by repeated exposure to peptide-pulsed irradated autologous B lymphoblasts.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A peptide-specific CTL line grown from polyclonals was able to recognize and lyse heterologous influenza B B/AA/86 infected targets presenting in the context of class II (HLA-DR1 and -DQ5). FACS analysis indicted that this cell line was 85% CD4+ (data not shown).

FirstInVivoProcess.InVivoProcessType: Environmental exposure to endemic/ubiquitous agent without evidence for disease

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Blood was collected from a healthy volunteer with a prior history of influenza infection. Strain not secified. CD4 CTL line was generated by dilution of CTL line incubated with irradiated allogenic PBLs and peptide-pulsed B lymphoblasts.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: A CD4+ CTL clone generated by limiting dilution from HA peptide-specific CTL line was able to recognize and lyse targets pulsed with peptide HA308-320. Polyclonal CTLs were also shown to recognize and lyse HA308-320 pulsed targets (Figure 5a).
